Event.name: Dominate_competitor
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen>, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some <fen>Patient</fen> in some <fen>Situation</fen>.
<ex><fex name="age">The fireballing righthander</fex> looked poised to <t>dominate</t> <fex name="Patient">the Yankees</fex> yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.</def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Situation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Situation</fen> within which the <fen>Agent</fen> is able to gain control over the <fen>Patient</fen> (thus excluding them from controlling the <fen>Situation</fen>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The period of time over which the domination occurs.
<ex>For England and France, <t>domination</t> over their colonies <fex name="dur">during the colonial period</fex> was mainly a cultural obligation.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the event as a whole, or of any of the participants that does not fit any of the other more specific Frame Elements.
<ex>He managed to be <t>dominant</t> over most of the rest of the staff, <fex name="man">in a good way</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The place where the domination occurs.
<ex>Women tend to <t>dominate</t>men <fex name="pla">at home and at Church</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the domination takes place.
<ex>Their role models might have <t>dominated</t> women <fex name="tim">in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: domination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of control over someone or something.

lexUnit.name: dominant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: most important, powerful, or influential.

lexUnit.name: strongman.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a leader who rules by the exercise of threats, force, or violence.
